snippet: As the Kentucky senator prepared to announce Tuesday that he will run for president, his advisers said he would not rely on being the son of a man who fared well in 2008 and 2012.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul, preparing to announce candidacy for 2016 Republican nomination, will seek to distance himself from legacy of his father Ron Paul, who had several unsuccessful presidential bids in past; elder Paul will likely have only minor role in campaign.
lead_paragraph: As the Kentucky senator prepared to announce Tuesday that he will run for president, his advisers said he would not rely on being the son of a man who fared well in 2008 and 2012.

headline.main: Ron Paul Is Expected to Play Little Role in Rand Paul’s Campaign
headline.print_headline: Another Presidential Run by Paul Family Means Muted Role for Father
